sentences.english: They will spend it all and much more before voters pronounce the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 在選民投票前，他們將會全部花光，或者再花更多。

sentences.english: A polling station is where I vote and is listed on my Elector Information Card.
sentences.chinese: 投票站是我前往投票的地方，在選民登記列明地點。

sentences.english: They checked to see if she enrolled among the voters of their district.
sentences.chinese: 他們複覈看看她是否被登記在他們區的選民名單中。

sentences.english: Do you think this is going to affect voter turnout?
sentences.chinese: 你們是否認爲這會影響選民投票率？

sentences.english: We also urge opposition parties to present their manifestoes to voters as early as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我們還敦促在野黨儘早發佈他們對選民的政治宣言。

sentences.english: His government's bunker-like mentality has damaged communication with voters.
sentences.chinese: 他領導的政府僵化的態度已損壞與選民的溝通。

sentences.english: Others, he said, defaced their ballot papers.
sentences.chinese: 他說，還有一些選民故意損壞了自己的選票。

sentences.english: His eloquent speech has won him the favor of the .
sentences.chinese: 他的好口才爲他贏得了選民的青睞。
非選民方面的信息沒有調查。

sentences.english: The choice between the two lies in the hands of US voters.
sentences.chinese: 在這兩人中間做出選擇的權利在美國選民手中。

sentences.english: Is the wrongdoer well liked by colleagues and constituents?
sentences.chinese: 犯了道德錯誤的人會被同僚和選民喜歡嗎？

sentences.english: Workers' Party (WP) reaching out to the constituents of Aljunied GRC.
sentences.chinese: 工人黨走訪阿裕尼集選區，接見選民。

sentences.english: Paradoxically, voters' grumpiness may be a spur for radical change.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾的是，選民的壞脾氣可能激發根本的變革。

sentences.english: It's a question of getting the right mix of policies to appeal to the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 問題是要有能投合選民心意的一整套相配得當的政策。

sentences.english: Political parties and voters have no freedom of speech, assembly and association in society.
sentences.chinese: 各政黨和選民沒有言論集會和結社自由。

sentences.english: Indeed, many voters feel as though they've been "kicked in the head.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，很多選民感覺他們就像遭了當頭一棒一樣。

definition: to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
